text: Oxford Industries, Inc. is a clothing company in the United States that sells expensive clothes. They have many well-known brands, like Tommy Bahama and Lilly Pulitzer. The company was started in 1942, when three people bought a clothing company that made uniforms for the military. In the 1960s, Oxford Industries became a part of the New York Stock Exchange. The first chairman and CEO was Sartain Lanier, who retired in 1981. His son, J. Hicks Lanier, became the new chairman and CEO. Now, Oxford Industries makes more than $1 billion in sales and has over 4,700 employees. They have offices in different parts of the world, including New York City, Seattle, and Hong Kong. == References == Category:Companies listed on the New York Stock Exchange Category:American clothing companies Category:1942 establishments in the United States
title: Oxford Industries
